name: glamour
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 the special exciting and attractive quality of a person, place, or activity: glamour of Who can resist the glamour of Hollywood?
More examplesFewer examplesCompared to the extravagance and glamour of last winter's clothes, this season's collection look simple, almost workaday.Modern luxury ships are a pale imitation of the glamour and style of the early ocean liners.The party's electoral message may be obscured by the glitz and glamour of its presentation.He was drawn to the metropolitan glamour and excitement of Paris.Some people are attracted by the glamour of working in television.
